column4: Does anyone know how compatible GeForce FX 7300GS is with Ubuntu?
nvidia typically is fine.. the 6000 series is rock solid..
Cause I belive I have some problems... Streaming video is really slow...
depends on how the stream was encoded.. flash can be problemmatic
Well, all streaming I have seen... Why can that be problematic?
did you enable the restricted drivers? if so which one?
I use nvidia-glx-173.
did you install that manually or by using ubuntu's restricted drivers manager?
Installed it in commander...
what's commander?
you mean command line?
The terminal...
Yeah.
Sorry, I'm quite new. =)(

ah.. so you downloaded the driver from nvidia directly.. that driver is quite old.. even the one in the hardware driver manager portion of ubuntu is much newer than that... upgrade your driver.. the latest I think is 196.x.x.x or something like that.
How do I upgrade that? Sorry for stupid questions. =)
get the latest driver from nvidia and install it the same way you did the last one.. you have to drop to a tty, shutdown gdm, install driver, restart gdm
That was a little bit to fast for me... :)
which version of ubuntu are you using?
what release?
Ubuntu 10.04.
this might look familure.. https://help.ubuntu.com/community/NvidiaManual
I will try on my own. Thanks! :)
